alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 7:06AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Imperial County through 745 AM PDT... At 706 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Brawley, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Calipatria, Alamorio and Wiest. This includes the following highways... CA Route 78 between mile markers 14 and 28. CA Route 111 near mile marker 22, and between mile markers 25 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial Valley
